content.p: University Park Campus, Nottingham, UK Today's world is complex. To solve its problems we need people with a range of knowledge and skills. We need Liberal Arts graduates. Liberal Arts at Nottingham is a flexible degree spanning the humanities, languages, science, social sciences and business that gives you: It’s your chance to nurture your creativity, unleash your potential and become a part of the solution to our current problems. Mandatory Year 1 Introduction to Liberal Arts Explorations: Space and Place Optional Classics and Archaeology Education English Film and Screen Studies Geography History Art History and Visual Culture International Media and Communications Maths Modern Languages and Cultures The above is a sample of the typical modules we offer, but is not intended to be construed or relied on as a definitive list of what might be available in any given year. This content was last updated on Friday 30 August 2024. Due to timetabling availability, there may be restrictions on some module combinations. The minimum contact time you will have is: Your lecturers will be available outside your scheduled contact time to discuss issues and develop your understanding. This can be in-person and/or online. As well as your timetabled sessions you'll carry out extensive independent study. This will include course reading and seminar preparation. As a guide 20 credits (a typical module) is about 200 hours of work (combined teaching and self-study). Class sizes vary depending on topic and type. A popular subject lecture may have up to 200 students while a specialised seminar may contain 10 students. Your Liberal Arts lecturers will be members of our academic staff. Subject lecturers will be from the relevant schools and departments many of whom are internationally recognised in their fields. Studying for a degree at the University of Nottingham will provide you with the type of skills and experiences that will prove invaluable in any career, whichever direction you decide to take. Throughout your time with us, our Careers and Employability Service can work with you to improve your employability skills even further; assisting with job or course applications, searching for appropriate work experience placements and hosting events to bring you closer to a wide range of prospective employers. Have a look at our careers page for an overview of all the employability support and opportunities that we provide to current students. The University of Nottingham is consistently named as one of the most targeted universities by Britain’s leading graduate employers (Ranked in the top ten in The Graduate Market in 2013-2020, High Fliers Research). University Park Campus covers 300 acres, with green spaces, wildlife, period buildings and modern facilities. It is one of the UK's most beautiful and sustainable campuses, winning a national Green Flag award every year since 2003. As an individual who thought she would have to forfeit some of her interests to fit a single or double honours program, Liberal Arts at Nottingham has allowed me to explore a huge range of disciplines and maximise my potential.
